SkyFuel is a ClimateTech startup developing sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) from captured carbon dioxide and green hydrogen. The aviation industry is one of the hardest-to-abate sectors, accounting for a significant percentage of global emissions. While electric planes may work for short hauls, a long-term solution for long-haul flights is needed. SkyFuel is building a production facility that uses a process called Power-to-Liquid, where renewable electricity is used to create green hydrogen via electrolysis, which is then combined with CO2 captured directly from the air to synthesize a drop-in sustainable aviation fuel.

This fuel is chemically identical to conventional jet fuel but can reduce lifecycle carbon emissions by up to 90%. The company's offtake agreements are with major airlines looking to decarbonize their operations. SkyFuel's vision is to power the future of air travel with a fuel that doesn't cost the earth, making sustainable flight a reality.

name: AquaPura
description:
AquaPura is a CleanTech company that has developed a low-cost, energy-efficient water purification system for remote communities and disaster relief. Access to clean drinking water remains a major challenge for billions of people worldwide. Traditional purification methods like reverse osmosis are often too expensive and energy-intensive for off-grid use. AquaPura's system uses a novel graphene-based filter that can remove bacteria, viruses, and chemical contaminants without requiring high pressure or electricity. It can be powered by a small solar panel or even by hand-cranking.

The device is portable, durable, and can purify thousands of liters of water per day. The company's business model involves selling the units to NGOs, government agencies, and aid organizations. AquaPura's mission is to provide a simple, affordable, and reliable source of clean water to anyone, anywhere, transforming public health and quality of life in underserved communities.

name: CloudSecure
description:
CloudSecure is a Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) platform that helps organizations identify and remediate misconfigurations and security risks across their multi-cloud environments. As companies migrate more infrastructure to cloud providers like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, they face a complex and ever-changing attack surface. A single misconfigured S3 bucket or IAM role can lead to a massive data breach. CloudSecure continuously scans a company's entire cloud infrastructure, comparing its configuration against security best practices and compliance frameworks like CIS and PCI-DSS.

The platform provides an automated, prioritized list of vulnerabilities and can often remediate them with a single click. It gives security teams a centralized, unified view of their security posture across all cloud accounts. CloudSecure's mission is to help organizations embrace the cloud with confidence, ensuring that their infrastructure is secure by default and compliant by design.

name: PhishGuard AI
description:
PhishGuard AI is an email security platform that uses advanced AI to stop phishing, business email compromise (BEC), and social engineering attacks. Traditional email security relies on static rules and blacklists, which are easily evaded by sophisticated attackers. PhishGuard AI takes a different approach by analyzing the content, context, and intent of every email. Its AI model understands the relationships between people within an organization and can flag anomalies, such as a sudden request for a wire transfer from a CEO's email that doesn't match their usual writing style.

The platform can also detect brand impersonation, malicious links, and attachments in real-time, quarantining threats before they reach the user's inbox. It provides a simple, one-click reporting button for users and gives administrators a clear dashboard of attack attempts. PhishGuard AI's goal is to be the last line of defense against the most dangerous email threats, protecting organizations from financial loss and data breaches.

name: IoTDefend
description:
IoTDefend is a cybersecurity platform that provides complete visibility and protection for all Internet of Things (IoT) devices on a network. From smart TVs and security cameras to industrial sensors and medical devices, IoT devices proliferate in corporate networks, but they are often insecure and unmanaged, creating a massive, unmonitored attack surface. IoTDefend automatically discovers every single connected device on a network, identifies its make, model, and operating system, and assesses its vulnerability profile.

The platform then applies network segmentation policies to isolate untrusted or vulnerable devices, preventing them from being used as a gateway to attack critical systems. It continuously monitors device behavior for signs of compromise. IoTDefend's mission is to secure the 'headless' devices that are powering the modern enterprise, ensuring that the convenience of IoT doesn't come at the cost of security.

name: StreamLive
description:
StreamLive is a platform that enables e-commerce brands and creators to host interactive, shoppable live-stream events. Live-stream shopping is a massive trend in Asia and is rapidly growing in the West, but the technology can be complex to set up. StreamLive provides an end-to-end solution that makes it easy for anyone to go live. The platform integrates directly with a brand's e-commerce store, allowing viewers to purchase products featured in the stream without ever leaving the video. It includes features like live polls, Q&A sessions, and exclusive flash sales to drive engagement and conversions.

The platform's analytics provide brands with detailed insights into viewer behavior, sales performance, and which products generated the most buzz. StreamLive's mission is to make live-stream commerce accessible to all brands, transforming passive online shopping into an entertaining and interactive community experience.

name: DTC Analytics
description:
DTC Analytics is a business intelligence platform specifically designed for direct-to-consumer (DTC) brands. DTC brands live and die by their customer data, but they often struggle to unify data from sources like Shopify, Facebook Ads, Klaviyo, and Google Analytics into a single, coherent view. DTC Analytics solves this by integrating with all the major DTC tools and providing a dashboard with pre-built, customizable reports that focus on the metrics that matter most: Customer Lifetime Value (LTV), Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC), churn rate, and contribution margin.

The platform uses AI to provide predictive insights, such as identifying which customer segments are most likely to churn or which marketing channels have the highest LTV. This allows DTC founders and marketers to make smarter, data-driven decisions about their ad spend and product strategy. DTC Analytics' vision is to be the central nervous system for the modern DTC brand.

name: Borderless
description:
Borderless is a platform that simplifies cross-border e-commerce for online merchants. Selling internationally is a huge growth opportunity for DTC brands, but it's fraught with complexity, including customs duties, international shipping, local taxes, and multi-currency payments. Borderless acts as a merchant of record, handling all of these complexities on behalf of the brand. It provides a localized checkout experience for customers in over 100 countries, showing them the final price including all duties and taxes in their local currency.

The platform manages international shipping from a network of global warehouses and handles all customs paperwork. Brands simply send their inventory to Borderless, and the platform takes care of the rest. By removing the friction of international sales, Borderless's mission is to empower any brand to sell to anyone, anywhere in the world, as easily as they sell domestically.

name: RentSpree
description:
RentSpree is a platform that streamlines the entire rental application process for landlords, property managers, and tenants. The traditional rental application process is a fragmented and frustrating experience involving paper forms, multiple credit check sites, and slow communication. RentSpree consolidates everything into a single, online application. Prospective tenants fill out one application and grant consent for their credit, criminal, and background checks to be pulled instantly. Landlords can then easily compare all applicants side-by-side in a clear, standardized format.

The platform also includes tools for communication, e-signing leases, and collecting rent payments. By digitizing and automating the rental process, RentSpree saves landlords time, helps them find qualified tenants faster, and provides a more transparent and modern experience for renters. Their mission is to make renting a home as easy and seamless as booking a hotel room.

name: PropIQ
description:
PropIQ is a real estate data analytics platform that provides investors and agents with deep insights into market trends and property values. The real estate market is driven by data, but much of the most valuable data is siloed, difficult to access, or expensive. PropIQ aggregates and analyzes data from multiple sources, including MLS listings, public records, and satellite imagery, to provide a comprehensive view of the market. Its platform offers predictive analytics, such as forecasting which neighborhoods are likely to see high appreciation or identifying undervalued properties.

It also provides tools for agents to create sophisticated comparative market analyses (CMAs) for their clients and for investors to analyze the potential ROI of a property. PropIQ's goal is to level the playing field by providing everyone, from the first-time homebuyer to the seasoned institutional investor, with the same high-quality data and analytical tools used by the top firms in the industry.

name: RenoPlan
description:
RenoPlan is a project management platform for home renovations. Renovating a home is notoriously stressful, often plagued by budget overruns, missed deadlines, and poor communication between homeowners and contractors. RenoPlan provides a centralized platform where all stakeholders—homeowners, general contractors, and subcontractors—can collaborate. It features a visual timeline, a budget tracker with real-time expense logging, a selection sheet for managing finishes and materials, and a messaging tool for communication.

The platform also includes a payment module that allows homeowners to release payments to contractors based on completed milestones, providing security for both parties. By bringing transparency and organization to a chaotic process, RenoPlan's mission is to make home renovations a more predictable, less stressful, and ultimately more enjoyable experience for everyone involved.

name: Rooted Farms
description:
Rooted Farms is an AgriTech company that operates a network of high-tech indoor vertical farms located in or near major cities. By growing leafy greens, herbs, and strawberries in a controlled environment, Rooted Farms can produce crops year-round, independent of weather or season. Their farms use 95% less water than traditional agriculture, no pesticides, and are located close to consumers, which drastically reduces food miles and ensures peak freshness and nutritional value. The produce is harvested and delivered to local grocery stores and restaurants within hours.

The company's technology stack includes proprietary LED lighting spectra, automated nutrient dosing systems, and robotic harvesting to maximize efficiency and yield. Rooted Farms' business model is based on long-term supply agreements with major grocery chains. Their vision is to create a more resilient and sustainable food system by localizing agriculture and providing communities with fresher, healthier, and more flavorful food.

name: SweetLeaf
description:
SweetLeaf is a FoodTech company that has developed a natural, zero-calorie sweetener from a proprietary leafy green plant. The search for a healthy, natural sugar alternative has led to options like stevia and monk fruit, but they often have a bitter aftertaste. SweetLeaf has discovered and cultivated a new plant variety that produces a sweet compound with a clean, sugar-like taste and no aftertaste. The company has developed a process to extract and purify this compound on a commercial scale.

Their sweetener is designed to be a drop-in replacement for sugar in a wide range of products, from beverages and yogurts to baked goods. SweetLeaf is initially targeting B2B customers, including major food and beverage manufacturers looking to reduce sugar in their products without compromising on taste. Their mission is to fight the global health crisis of sugar-related diseases by providing a perfect, natural, and healthy alternative.

name: TraceChain
description:
TraceChain is a blockchain-based platform that provides end-to-end supply chain traceability for the food and beverage industry. Consumers are increasingly demanding to know where their food comes from, how it was produced, and whether it is authentic and safe. TraceChain solves this by creating an immutable digital record of a product's journey from farm to table. At each step of the supply chain—harvest, processing, shipping, and retail—a new entry is added to the blockchain, creating a transparent and tamper-proof history.

Consumers can simply scan a QR code on the product's packaging to see its entire story, including the farm it came from, the date it was harvested, and the certifications it holds. This builds trust and allows brands to command a premium for their products. TraceChain's mission is to bring radical transparency to the food supply chain, empowering consumers and holding producers accountable.

name: IoT SatConnect
description:
IoT SatConnect is a SpaceTech company that operates a constellation of small satellites dedicated to providing global connectivity for IoT devices. While terrestrial networks cover most populated areas, they leave vast swaths of the planet—oceans, deserts, and remote rural areas—without connectivity. This is a major barrier for industries like agriculture, logistics, and maritime that need to track assets in these regions. IoT SatConnect offers a low-cost, low-power satellite service that allows IoT sensors to transmit small amounts of data from anywhere on Earth.

Their service is designed for applications like tracking shipping containers, monitoring soil moisture on remote farms, or checking the status of pipelines. The company provides the satellite modems and a simple API for integration. IoT SatConnect's vision is to connect the billions of things that are currently unconnected, unlocking a new wave of data-driven innovation for global industries.

name: LunarLogistics
description:
LunarLogistics is a SpaceTech startup developing a robotic lander and rover system to provide payload delivery and services on the surface of the Moon. With the new space race and the Artemis program, there is a growing need for commercial logistics services on the Moon to support scientific outposts and future resource extraction. LunarLogistics is building a versatile lander that can deliver up to 500 kg of cargo—from scientific instruments to construction materials—to any location on the lunar surface.

The company is also developing a rover that can be deployed from the lander to transport payloads, scout terrain, and perform site preparation. Their customers are space agencies like NASA and ESA, as well as private companies planning lunar operations. LunarLogistics' mission is to build the first commercial logistics network on the Moon, enabling a sustainable human presence on Earth's celestial neighbor.

name: Solaris Space Power
description:
Solaris Space Power is an ambitious SpaceTech company developing technology for Space-Based Solar Power (SBSP). The concept of SBSP involves deploying massive solar arrays in orbit that collect sunlight 24/7 and beam the energy wirelessly to Earth as microwaves, where it is converted into electricity. This technology promises a clean, constant, and virtually limitless source of power. Solaris Space Power is focused on solving the key technical challenges, including lightweight solar panels, wireless power transmission, and large-scale in-space assembly.

While still in the R&D phase, the company is working on a series of technology demonstration missions in partnership with government agencies. Their long-term vision is to build and operate the first commercial SBSP plant, capable of powering a city. Solaris Space Power's ultimate goal is to provide a foundational solution to the world's energy and climate crises by harnessing the immense power of the sun in space.
